Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two pictures of the same plant species to compare and show one plant with water and one plant without water.
The student can illustrate the plant with water being healthy, with green leaves and a strong stem.
The student can illustrate the plant without water being wilted or shriveled, showing signs of not being healthy.
The student can use symbols or colors to indicate the presence of water in one drawing and the lack of water in the other.
The student can include details such as the sun to show that the plant also needs light.
